content.description:
Fingery shenanigans with use of weight shutting in the beginning. Dynamic move to finish at the end. The arrête, and feet around it are very useful.

On the same boulder as the "V2 that was great but got crazily broken recently". Around to the right of that problem. starts on the same arrête as "Raggety Andy" but veers to the right to finish on the jug.
Pad, spot. Watch water on the pad.

Apparently easier for short people. A few shoulder moves over a small lip with scrunched up close feet. Distinguished by odd large pocket like rubbings in the front.

Closer to the approach.
Pad, spot. Watch water and uneven ground on the pad placement.

climbs.name: Me gusta mirar las Chicas Calientes

content.description:
Starts at the same start as "Teenagers in Tiaras". Traverses left with heel hooks and good in cuts. Finish on the left corner before topping out.

The left side on the same face of "Teenagers in Tiaras"
Pad, Spot.

Beautiful heart shaped formation. The crux includes a dynamic shoulder move to good incut ridges. While short, this climb is an excellent warm-up in terms of technique accuracy, focus and precision.

In the middle of the scattered boulders. It seems this side is "too short" to have anything worth doing, however that is not the case. Two obvious low jugs form the start. Heel/toe work is perfect for the feet. Top out and turn to face the ocean. The Perfect relaxation.
Pad recommended.

An hourglass shaped face of a boulder fairly close to the ocean, Starts by the opening of the gap between two boulders. Climb the obvious arrête and curvature shape.  
  
 So named satirically describing false ideals promoted about young girl's (and guy's) body shapes.

Note that dabbing on the other boulder is out, which is why the original FA was considered invalid.
A pad, a spot. Pretty chill.

Two new super easy, fun, flowy warmups were uncovered in the new season. Both are variations of the same climb, this one finishing on the left.

On the left side on the boulder of "Fidget like a Midget". Start low, end on the cool looking holds and topout.
Pad, spot why not.

climbs.name: You can do it! Put 'yer back into it

content.description:
A variation on "China Teacups" this is a little fun chimney climb between 2 boulders. The lack of great feet and weird ledges at your back make it almost shouldery and awkward at times.

Starts in the centre gap between "Teenagers in Tiaras" and "Me gusta mirrar las chicas calientes" facing towards the side of "Me gusta mirrar las chic as clients" (away from the ocean").Both faces are in, but you must start directly on the ground.
Hard to spot, and no pads. Rocks have chipped off of this fairly easily so watch the fingers. Not too high either so you're fine.
Top side with lots of new climbs - easy hard and lots in between
